comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Commander of the "Nantucket," a steamer involved in a sea disaster (the "Nantucket" collided with the "Monroe" off Virginia, 41 died).

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Thanks for the additional info. in connecting these folks with the ship collision.  We'll include this info. in the records next time we update

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Monroe

comment.author: 30906332@N08
comment._content:
My great grandfather was a wireless operator on the Nantucket.  I have a handwritten recommendation letter from Osmyn Berry for my great grandfather, Adolph Doehler, dated May 29, 1914.  
I also have a letter dated Feb 24, 1914 from the Marconi Wireless Telegraph Company of America to my great grandfather as "First Marconi Operator" offering, "sincere thanks for the able way in which you discharged your duty in the unfortunate accident which occurred between the "Nantucket" and the "Monroe"."
